author: Special Correspondent
text:
Underworld gangster Chhota Rajan has agreed to give his voice samples at a special Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) court on Thursday

The court also granted permission to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to take the voice sample of Rajan in connection with the case pertaining to the murder of journalist Jyotirmoy Dey.

Rajan, who is currently lodged in Delhi’s Tihar Jail, deposed via video conferencing before judge A L Pansare.

Rajan, who was brought from Indonesia after his arrest there last year, had initially consented to having his voice samples recorded, but had later backtracked saying he needed to seek legal opinion.

Earlier, the court had sought Rajan's reply to CBI's plea to collect the underworld don's voice sample. CBI special public prosecutor Bharat Badami said it was “vital” to have samples of Rajan’s voice. “It would be the clinching evidence before filing the chargesheet.”

The 54-year-old gangster is facing apver 70 cases in Maharashtra, which includes the J Dey murder case.

Dey was shot dead in Powai in 2011, allegedly at Rajan’s behest.
title: Chhota Rajan agrees to give voice sample
